greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of uniformly normal integer partitions of n.
comment: An integer partition is uniformly normal if either (1) it is of the form (x, x, ..., x) for some x > 0, or (2a) it spans an initial interval of positive integers, and (2b) its multiplicities, sorted in weakly decreasing order, are themselves a uniformly normal integer partition.
link: A. David Christopher and M. Davamani Christober, Relatively Prime Uniform Partitions, Gen. Math. Notes, Vol. 13, No. 2, December, 2012, pp.1-12.
example: The a(6) = 6 uniformly normal integer partitions are (6), (33), (321), (222), (2211), (111111). Missing from this list are (51), (42), (411), (3111), (21111).
The a(21) = 14 uniformly normal integer partitions (n = 21):
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Aug 01 2018
